page.title: 05TOWARDS CLEEVE COMMON
page.content: ONE THURSDAY A GROUP OF US WENT UP ON CLEEVE COMMON. WHEN WE GOT THERE WE GOT OUT OF THE CAR AND WENT INTO A FIELD. I TOOK A PHOTOGRAPH OF{ {PRESTBURY}AND{WHADDON.}THEN WE WALKED OVER TO A BEECH HANGER. I TOOK A PHOTOGRAPH OF IT. WE ALSO TOOK SOME PHOTOGRAPHS OF FLOWERS. SOME OF THE FLOWERS WERE{COWSLIPS, BUTTERCUPS, {CLOVER, ROCK ROSES}AND{VETCHES.}THE AREA WAS FULL OF CORNFIELDS WHICH HAD A LANE RUNNING THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THEM. MOST OF THEM WERE FULL OF{WHEAT} AND{BARLEY.}A FEW OF THE FIELDS WERE NOT USED FOR CROPS BUT WERE USED FOR CATTLE GRAZING. THERE ARE A FEW WOODED PLACES ON THE EDGE OF SOME FIELDS. ON THE COMMON IT WAS VERY LONELY. THERE WERE NO BUILDINGS AND ONLY ONE OR TWO CARS PASSED US IN THE LANE.
